summary: Customs and Border Protection enforces customs and trade laws that protect the U.S. economy and the health and safety of the American people. CBP staff conduct trade enforcement activities at more than 300 ports by, among other things, collecting revenue, identifying noncompliant imports, and seizing prohibited goods, such as counterfeit drugs. However, we found that CBP generally had not met the staffing levels set by...
title: Customs and Border Protection: Improved Planning Needed to Strengthen Trade Enforcement
